story_parts.text:
I was so excited to start 2nd grade. I had heard all about how much fun it would be and how I would learn so many new things. I couldn't wait to make new friends too.

On my first day, I walked into my new classroom and saw all of the other kids. Everyone was so friendly and I instantly felt at home. We started the day by learning all about our new teacher, Mrs. Smith. She was so nice and I could tell she

next_options.0: She told us that we were going to have a lot of fun this year
next_options.1: She told us that we were going to learn a lot this year

story_parts.text: She told us that we were going to have a lot of fun this year and learn so many new things. I was so excited and couldn't wait to get started. Throughout the year, I made so many new friends and learned so much. I loved 2nd grade and am so glad I had such a great experience.

next_options.0: She was right, I had so much fun and learned so many new things
next_options.1: I didn't like 2nd grade as much as I thought I would

story_parts.text: I thought 2nd grade would be so much fun, but I didn't like it as much as I thought I would. I didn't make any new friends and I found the work to be really hard. I was so disappointed and didn't want to go to school. I'm glad I stuck it out though, because now I love school and have made so many friends.

next_options.0: I was so disappointed and didn't want to go to school
next_options.1: I was so disappointed and didn't want to go to school, so I decided to talk to my teacher

story_parts.text: I was so disappointed and didn't want to go to school, so I decided to talk to my teacher about it. She was really understanding and helped me to see that 2nd grade wasn't as bad as I thought it was. She encouraged me to keep trying and to reach out to make friends. I'm so glad I did, because now I love 2nd grade and have made so many great friends.

next_options.0: The teacher told me that I should try to reach out to make friends
next_options.1: The teacher told me that I should keep trying and not give up

quiz_parts.question: What did the protagonist do when she was feeling disappointed about school?

options.0: She decided to talk to her teacher about it
options.1: She decided to stop going to school
